results.title: Effect of Amlodipine in Stroke and Myocardial infarction: A Systematic Review and Meta-analysis
results.text_hl: a Forest plot of hazard ratio (HR) of @<m>DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@myocardial infarction@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@MI@@@) (@<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ vs. other drugs), b Forest plot of HR of @<m>DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@MI@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ vs. placebo)

results.title: Amlodipine in the current management of hypertension
results.text_hl: Additionally, @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ is a wise choice for older adults due to its ability to control BP and protect against @DISEASE_Stroke @DISEASE_MESH:D020521 @@@stroke@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@myocardial infarction@@@.

citations.NLM: Wang JG, Palmer BF, Vogel Anderson K, Sever P. Amlodipine in the current management of hypertension J Clin Hypertens (Greenwich). 2023 Aug 7;():. PMID: 37551050
citations.BibTeX: @article{37551050, title={Amlodipine in the current management of hypertension}, author={Wang JG and Palmer BF and Vogel Anderson K and Sever P}, journal={J Clin Hypertens (Greenwich)}}

results.title: [The effect of antihypertensive chronotherapy on indicators of the daily blood pressure profile in elderly patients with arterial hypertension with a history of myocardial infarction.]
results.text_hl: In 62 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with a history of @<m>DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@myocardial infarction@@@ and @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ at the age of 60-74, a fixed combination of @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@, @CHEMICAL_Lisinopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Rosuvastatin_Calcium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068718 @@@rosuvastatin@@@ at a dose of 5/10/10 mg 2 hours before reaching maximum systolic blood pressure (preventive chronotherapy), in 63 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with similar diseases and age, this drug is taken at a dose of 5/10/10mg in the evening, and in 58 people - in the morning (traditional treatment).

citations.NLM: Agarkov NM, Proschayev KI, Lutay YA, Ilnitskiy AN, Korneeva SI, Markelova AM, Kolomiets VI. [The effect of antihypertensive chronotherapy on indicators of the daily blood pressure profile in elderly patients with arterial hypertension with a history of myocardial infarction.] Adv Gerontol. 2020;33(5):972-976. PMID: 33550755
citations.BibTeX: @article{33550755, title={[The effect of antihypertensive chronotherapy on indicators of the daily blood pressure profile in elderly patients with arterial hypertension with a history of myocardial infarction.]}, author={Agarkov NM and Proschayev KI and Lutay YA and Ilnitskiy AN and Korneeva SI and Markelova AM and Kolomiets VI}, journal={Adv Gerontol}, volume={33}, number={5}, pages={972-976}}

results.title: The effects of antihypertensive class on gout in older adults: secondary analysis of the Antihypertensive and Lipid-Lowering Treatment to Prevent Heart Attack Trial.
results.text_hl: METHODS: The Antihypertensive and @CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@Lipid@@@-Lowering Treatment to Prevent @<m>DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@Heart Attack@@@ Trial (ALLHAT) was a randomized clinical trial on the effects of first-step @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ therapy with @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@, @CHEMICAL_Chlorthalidone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002752 @@@chlorthalidone@@@, or @CHEMICAL_Lisinopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ on fatal @DISEASE_Coronary_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D003327 @@@coronary heart disease@@@ or nonfatal @<m>DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@myocardial infarction@@@ (1994-2002).

citations.NLM: Juraschek SP, Simpson LM, Davis BR, Shmerling RH, Beach JL, Ishak A, Mukamal KJ. The effects of antihypertensive class on gout in older adults: secondary analysis of the Antihypertensive and Lipid-Lowering Treatment to Prevent Heart Attack Trial. J Hypertens. 2020 May;38(5):954-960. PMID: 31977576
citations.BibTeX: @article{31977576, title={The effects of antihypertensive class on gout in older adults: secondary analysis of the Antihypertensive and Lipid-Lowering Treatment to Prevent Heart Attack Trial.}, author={Juraschek SP and Simpson LM and Davis BR and Shmerling RH and Beach JL and Ishak A and Mukamal KJ}, journal={J Hypertens}, volume={38}, number={5}, pages={954-960}}

results.title: Contributions of Systolic and Diastolic Blood Pressures to Cardiovascular Outcomes in the ALLHAT Study.
results.text_hl: METHODS: This study analyzed ALLHAT (Antihypertensive and @CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@Lipid@@@-Lowering Treatment to Prevent @<m>DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@Heart Attack@@@ Trial) data, which randomized adults to @CHEMICAL_Chlorthalidone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002752 @@@chlorthalidone@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@, or @CHEMICAL_Lisinopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@.

citations.NLM: Itoga NK, Tawfik DS, Montez-Rath ME, Chang TI. Contributions of Systolic and Diastolic Blood Pressures to Cardiovascular Outcomes in the ALLHAT Study. J Am Coll Cardiol. 2021 Oct 26;78(17):1671-1678. PMID: 34674811

results.title: Amlodipine: a pharmacoeconomic review.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: A combined analysis of two trials comparing angiotensin receptor blockers (ARBs) with a calcium channel blocker @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ suggested that @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ provided more protection against @DISEASE_Stroke @DISEASE_MESH:D020521 @@@stroke@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@myocardial infarction@@@ than ARBs.

citations.NLM: de Portu S, Mantovani LG. Amlodipine: a pharmacoeconomic review. J Med Econ. 2009 Mar;12(1):60-8. PMID: 19450066
citations.BibTeX: @article{19450066, title={Amlodipine: a pharmacoeconomic review.}, author={de Portu S and Mantovani LG}, journal={J Med Econ}, volume={12}, number={1}, pages={60-8}}

results.title: Amlodipine monotherapy in chronic stable angina.
results.text_hl: Four weeks of treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ produced a significant (p < 0.05) reduction from baseline in both the mean (+/- SE) number of @<m>DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@anginal attacks@@@/week (from 13.3 +/- 1.5 to 1.6 +/- 0.5) and the mean (+/- SE) number of @CHEMICAL_Isosorbide_Dinitrate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007548 @@@isosorbide dinitrate@@@ tablets consumed per week (12.1 +/- 1.5 to 2.6 +/- 0.8).

citations.NLM: Petkar S, Sethi KK, Sudha R, Sharma SM, Arora R, Khalilullah M. Amlodipine monotherapy in chronic stable angina. Indian Heart J. 1994 Mar-Apr;46(2):85-8. PMID: 7989081
citations.BibTeX: @article{7989081, title={Amlodipine monotherapy in chronic stable angina.}, author={Petkar S and Sethi KK and Sudha R and Sharma SM and Arora R and Khalilullah M}, journal={Indian Heart J}, volume={46}, number={2}, pages={85-8}}
